alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued March 04 at 1:01AM PST until March 04 at 8:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING FOR LIGHTNING STRIKES... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO NOON PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, isolated thunderstorms with cloud to ground lightning are expected. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet. Local sets to 8 feet in San Diego County. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas and Orange County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, until 8 AM PST this morning. For the High Surf Advisory, from noon today to noon PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Lightning presents a particular hazard. Large waves and strong rip currents will create dangerous swimming conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lightning threat reduced in Orange County after 4 AM.
info.instruction: Cloud to ground lightning could be deadly. If exposed on the beach, take cover. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
